intro: Coluteastrum subumbellatum, commonly known as the small umbellate bladderwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of purple or white. The plant grows in wet, marshy environments and is often found in coastal areas or along riverbanks. It has a short life cycle, completing its growth and reproduction within a single growing season. Its unique adaptations allow it to thrive in nutrient-poor, waterlogged soils.
